p: Evaluating the correlates of TB-HIV coinfection in bivariate and multivariable logistic regression analyses, we found that the odds of TB-HIV coinfection after adjustment for educational status, ethnicity and settlement was significantly higher for unmarried patients and those with a positive history of cigarette smoking and alcohol consumption. The odds of TB-HIV coinfection were also higher for females compared to males although not statistically significant ( Table 3).
